snippet: Senators emerged from a closed-door meeting saying  they were confident an agreement could be reached Tuesday to end the standoff over a change to filibuster rules, though no deal had been struck.
abstract: Senators emerge from closed-door meeting saying they are confident an agreement can be reached to end standoff over change to filibuster rules, though no deal is struck; Majority Leader Harry Reid has vowed to change procedural option if Republicans do not stop blocking Pres Obama's nominees to executive branch positions.

byline.original: By JONATHAN WEISMAN and ASHLEY PARKER

lead_paragraph: Senators emerged from a closed-door meeting saying  they were confident an agreement could be reached Tuesday to end the standoff over a change to filibuster rules, though no deal had been struck.

headline.main: Senate’s Leader Sets Showdown Over Changes to Filibuster
headline.print_headline: Senate’s Leader Sets Showdown Over Filibuster
